Class DelayEffect

java.lang.Object
  com.craigl.softsynth.DelayEffect
All Implemented Interfaces:
SampleProviderIntfc
public class DelayEffect
extends java.lang.Object
implements SampleProviderIntfc

Delay Effect

Variable delay between 1 and 2000 milliseconds

Author:
craiglindley

Constructor Detail

DelayEffect

public DelayEffect()
Delay Effect Class Constructor

Creates a DelayEffect instance setup with default values

DelayEffect is initially bypassed

Method Detail

setBypassed

public void setBypassed(boolean bypassed)
Sets the state of the DelayEffect

Parameters:
bypassed - If true the effect is bypassed; if false the effect is operational

setDryWetMixPercent

public void setDryWetMixPercent(double dryWetMixPercent)
Sets the dry / wet mix for the DelayEffect

Parameters:
dryWetMixPercent - The percentage of wet signal in the mix

setDelayInMs

public void setDelayInMs(int delayInMs)
Sets the delay time for the DelayEffect

Valid values between 1 and 2000 milliseconds

Parameters:
delayInMs - Delay time in milliseconds

setFeedbackPercent

public void setFeedbackPercent(double feedbackPercent)
Sets the feedback level which is the amount of output feedback to the input.

Parameters:
feedbackPercent - The percentage of the output feedback to the input

setSampleProvider

public void setSampleProvider(SampleProviderIntfc provider)
Setup the provider of samples

Parameters:
provider - The provider of samples for this DelayEffect

getSamples

public int getSamples(byte[] buffer)
Process a buffer full of samples pulled from the sample provider

Specified by:
getSamples in interface SampleProviderIntfc
Parameters:
buffer - Buffer in which the samples are to be processed
Returns:
Count of number of bytes processed
